sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is now serving NWA! They are a family owned and operated full service fabrication and installation company that specializes in quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. Contact them today for a complimentary quote!

posts.title: Arkansas Filmmakers To Screen Feb. 25 At The Walton Arts Center
posts.content:
The 2022 Fayetteville Film Fest (FFF) is rolling and has quite a bit more to offer as the Festival continues.

  • Local stories: This Friday, Feb. 25, will mark the 2nd part of 4 weekends for the film festival, and the theme is Arkansas Filmmakers. The screening will be at 7p and will feature narrative and documentary films, showcasing the filmmaking talent across Arkansas. 
  • Watch: The titles of the 5 films for Friday’s screening along with their directors and a plot snippet have been released on the WAC’s website. The films all explore themes of disconnection and grief as well as renewed connection and healing. The next screenings of the FFF will be on March 12 and May 26. 

For more info and tickets, click HERE.

posts.title: Peel Compton Foundation Hosting Spring Break Camps
posts.content:
Spring Break is around the corner, and you might be wondering what in the world you and your kids are going to do! Well, Peel Compton Foundation (PCF) is prepared with hands-on camps and experiences around Bentonville. 

  • Much to do: PCF is hosting 4 different opportunities for all ages over the week of March 21. There will be Coler Kids Spring Break Camp, Peel Museum Spring Break Camp, The Quiver Spring Break Camp, and Osage Park Free Wetland Tours throughout the week.
  • Never bored: With each event, there is opportunity for education and fun! Learn about wetlands, Arkansas's history, gardens, bikes, crafts, shoot bows and arrows, play games and more.

For more information, click HERE.

posts.title: Startup Crawl To Return After 2-Year Hiatus
posts.content:
On April 8, Arkansas’s biggest startup party is returning to Fayetteville and bringing together some of NWA’s most innovative.

  • Back again: After a 2-year hiatus, the Northwest Arkansas Startup Crawl by Startup Junkie is happening on April 8. It will start on Fayetteville’s downtown square and make stops on the way to the Pryor Center where dozens of Arkansas startups will be set up.
  • Brews and tunes: Attendees will experience live musical performances, local breweries, and multiple beer gardens in addition to the meet and greet with the region’s most exciting startup founders.

Startup Junkie is still on the lookout for more event sponsors, crawl stops, and startups for the annual event. Anyone interested can contact them HERE.

posts.title: On-Demand Public Transportation Arriving To Bentonville, Fayetteville
posts.content:
Starting tomorrow, Feb. 22, public transit with Ozark Regional Transit Authority (ORT) will establish an on-demand service in Bentonville and Fayetteville. 

  • Free and easy: Described as the Uber of public transit, ORT has developed an on-demand transit model where passengers can schedule rides using the smartphone app ORT On Demand. The app allows riders to move a cursor to a preferred pick-up destination and see a live arrival time for their ORT vehicle. 
  • Changes: Tomorrow in Bentonville, all traditional fixed routes will transition to on-demand. In Fayetteville, the new service will eliminate 1 traditional fixed route, and 2 will continue to operate alongside on-demand transit. The 3 fixed routes in Springdale will go unchanged. 

Read the Talk Business & Politics story HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville Chamber Partners With Cloud Company For Remote Worker Program
posts.content:
For those of you who have decided to work with the utmost autonomy this next piece of news is for you as there’s a new remote working program in Bentonville.

  • Cloud tech: Through its Rural Empowerment Program, Pax8 is hiring remote workers in the Northwest Arkansas Region. The company is connecting rural communities with tech careers, focusing on small to mid-sized businesses, and cloud serviced based technology.
  • New gig: Pax8 has been on Inc. magazine’s annual list of the 5,000 fastest-growing companies 4 years in a row and is currently offering jobs with a range from $50k to over $160k per year. Positions range from entry to senior-level roles. 

Click HERE for job information. Learn more about the Rural Empowerment Program and Pax8 HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• All-stars: Congrats to the FHS Girls Wrestling Team for placing 2nd in the state tournament!
  • Home run: Interested in some batting practice with the Naturals? You're invited, March 3.
  • Assistance: Non-profits in Fayetteville are encouraged to apply for the American Rescue Act funds.
  • Education: A number of school board seats are available throughout Northwest Arkansas.
  • Concerts: Are you keeping up with the summer show list at the AMP? Which ones will you be attending?
  • Platform: Have a story for the region? We can tell it. Check out our ad deals!
